items.longDescription:
UT Socks

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: Basquiat Socks
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Do not tumble dry.

items.designDetail:
- Fabric Weight: Normal
- Sock Fit: Regular
items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.
items.longDescription:
UT Socks

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. Since its founding in 1987, in accordance with Andy Warhol’s will, The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts has established itself among the leading funders of contemporary art in the United States. Proceeds the Foundation receives from licensing projects such as this contribute to the Foundation’s endowment from which these grants are distributed.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
items.name: Andy Warhol Socks
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Do not tumble dry.

items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.
items.longDescription:
UT Socks

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

items.longDescription:
Kunio Okawara, the mechanical designer in charge of mobile suits, drew an exclusive artwork for UT. Commemorating the 45th anniversary, this historic piece features a lineup of legendary mobile suits newly illustrated by him.
*Mobile suits featured on the T-shirt: GUNDAM, Z GUNDAM, BURNING GUNDAM, WING GUNDAM ZERO, TURN A GUNDAM, FREEDOM GUNDAM, UNICORN GUNDAM, JUSTICE GUNDAM

Mobile Suit GUNDAM 45th Anniversary

This limited collection features exclusive illustrations by Kunio Okawara, one of the original creators and the mechanical designer behind the giant robot, Gundam, which has captivated many people. The collection includes illustrations from the original “Mobile Suit Gundam” series, artwork from “Mobile Suit Gundam SEED” series, whose theatrical anime debuted in 2024, and designs from “Mobile Suit Gundam the Witch from Mercury,” a worldwide hit.

©SOTSU・SUNRISE
items.name: GUNDAM UT(Short Sleeve T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.

items.freeInformation: Shahi Exports Pvt Ltd, Industrial Plot No. 1, Near Metro Station, Sector 28, Faridabad, Haryana, 121008 India
items.longDescription:
Disney in Blue

BUAISOU, an indigo dyer and farmer collective known for blending tradition with modern craftsmanship, has garnered worldwide attention. Inspired by the rich hues of natural indigo, UNIQLO has launched an exclusive collection featuring Mickey Mouse and his friends as its motifs. Enjoy this beautiful lineup of blues crafted from the finest indigo. Note: The products use synthetic dyes inspired by natural indigo.

BUAISOU
Founded in 2015 and based in Kamiita Town, Tokushima Prefecture, BUAISOU manages the entire indigo dyeing process—from cultivating indigo and producing the dye material, "sukumo," to crafting the final products— traditionally carried out by separate artisans. In addition to creating original indigo-dyed items and collaborating with others, they also participate in exhibitions and workshops both in Japan and abroad,sharing the beauty of natural indigo through various methods.

©Disney
items.name: Disney in Blue UT (Graphic T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.careInstruction:
Recommendations for care:
When using a washing machine, select a cold temperature setting and cycle with lowest spin. No Tumbler/Dryer.
Remove your linen quickly from washer.
Adjust it to cut down wrinkles by hand.
Hang it to dry in the shade using a hanger. Avoid direct sunlight.

items.longDescription:
NY POP ART

UT has long partnered with pop art pioneers, including Andy Warhol, Keith Haring, and Jean-Michel Basquiat. These legendary artists have left behind various works that make art more accessible and enjoyable for people. Experience the joy of wearing pop art that is loved across generations.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: NY POP ART Archive UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. UT has long partnered with pop art pioneers, including Andy Warhol, Keith Haring, and Jean-Michel Basquiat. These legendary artists have left behind various works that make art more accessible and enjoyable for people. Experience the joy of wearing pop art that is loved across generations.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. Since its founding in 1987, in accordance with Andy Warhol’s will, The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts has established itself among the leading funders of contemporary art in the United States. Proceeds the Foundation receives from licensing projects such as this contribute to the Foundation’s endowment from which these grants are distributed.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.

items.longDescription:
The front of the T-shirt is embroidered with a design depicting Doraemon with the glass pyramid, the main entrance of the museum. The back of the T-shirt features an original illustration of Doraemon and Nobita visiting the Louvre at night.

Doraemon meets the Louvre

Doraemon, Japan’s popular character created by Fujiko・F・Fujio, and his friends visits the Louvre, enjoying its art and even stepping into the world of its masterpieces. Enjoy this unique UT collection, where you can journey with Doraemon and his friends through the timeless and radiant world of art that continues to shine across space and time.

Inspired by: Louvre Pyramid © I.M. Pei
© Fujiko-Pro, Shogakukan, TV-Asahi, Shin-ei, and ADK
items.name: Doraemon meets the Louvre UT (Short Sleeve T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.longDescription:
Doraemon is depicted in this original artwork inspired by Johannes Vermeer's painting “Astronomer”.

Doraemon meets the Louvre

Doraemon, Japan’s popular character created by Fujiko・F・Fujio, and his friends visits the Louvre, enjoying its art and even stepping into the world of its masterpieces. Enjoy this unique UT collection, where you can journey with Doraemon and his friends through the timeless and radiant world of art that continues to shine across space and time.

Inspired by: The Astronomer / Johannes VERMEER
© Fujiko-Pro, Shogakukan, TV-Asahi, Shin-ei, and ADK

items.longDescription:
This scene depicts Doraemon making sculptures of Nobita, Shizuka, Suneo and Gian, and was inspired by The Winged Victory of Samothrace, one of the most famous and popular sculptures in the Louvre.

Doraemon meets the Louvre

Doraemon, Japan’s popular character created by Fujiko・F・Fujio, and his friends visits the Louvre, enjoying its art and even stepping into the world of its masterpieces. Enjoy this unique UT collection, where you can journey with Doraemon and his friends through the timeless and radiant world of art that continues to shine across space and time.

Inspired by: The Winged Victory of Samothrace / Hellenistic Art (c. 190 BC), Island of Samothrace (northern Aegean)
© Fujiko-Pro, Shogakukan, TV-Asahi, Shin-ei, and ADK

Doraemon meets the Louvre

Doraemon, Japan’s popular character created by Fujiko・F・Fujio, and his friends visits the Louvre, enjoying its art and even stepping into the world of its masterpieces. Enjoy this unique UT collection, where you can journey with Doraemon and his friends through the timeless and radiant world of art that continues to shine across space and time.

Mona Lisa – Portrait of Lisa Gherardini, wife of Francesco del Giocondo / Leonardo DA VINCI

© Fujiko-Pro, Shogakukan, TV-Asahi, Shin-ei, and ADK

items.careInstruction:
Recommendations for care:
When using a washing machine, select a cold temperature setting and cycle with lowest spin. No Tumbler/Dryer.
Remove your linen quickly from washer.
Adjust it to cut down wrinkles by hand.
Hang it to dry in the shade using a hanger. Avoid direct sunlight.

items.careInstruction:
Recommendations for care:
When using a washing machine, select a cold temperature setting and cycle with lowest spin. No Tumbler/Dryer.
Remove your linen quickly from washer.
Adjust it to cut down wrinkles by hand.
Hang it to dry in the shade using a hanger. Avoid direct sunlight.

features.text: High-performance outerwear for changeable weather. Windproof with a comfortable mesh lining.

Functional fabric with a windproof laminated film. Water-repellent finish protects against light rain. Without perfluorinated chemicals (PFAS). *The fabric is coated with a water-repellent agent so the effect lasts longer. The finish is not permanent. Moderately crisp, wrinkled texture goes well with sporty and casual styles.
The hood rolls up inside the collar.
Waist pockets plus practical inner pockets.
Drawstring in the hem allows you to adjust the fit.
